intro: Aspidogyne lutea, commonly known as the yellow aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its family.
